summary: This document is an itemized telephone bill for an account, detailing numerous local, long distance, and international calls made and received over several days in July 2006. The calls are primarily to/from locations in New York, including White Plains, New York City, and the Bronx, with some calls to Columbia, MD. It appears to be a billing record likely obtained as part of a financial investigation. This document is a detailed itemized phone bill for a cellular account, covering calls from July 30, 2006, to August 5, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily between New York City locations and a location designated 'White Pls, NY' (likely White Plains, NY), with some calls to Beverly Hills, CA. The bill includes mobile-to-mobile calls and directory assistance calls, providing a log of communication patterns during this period. This document is a T-Mobile phone bill detailing itemized call records for an account from July 21 to August 8, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from the White Plains, NY area, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile. The bill includes service charges, taxes, and fees. This document is a multi-page itemized telephone bill for a mobile account, covering calls made and received from July 22 to July 28, 2006. It details call destinations, times, durations, and charges, primarily showing high-frequency calls to and from locations in New York, including White Plains, the Bronx, Brooklyn, and Queens. The document appears to be part of financial records seized or subpoenaed in the investigation. This document is a detailed telephone billing record (pages 42-54 of 75) for an account, covering calls from July 28, 2006, to August 5, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily between New York City locations (White Plains, New York, Bronx, Brooklyn) and Beverly Hills, CA, with many calls occurring late at night and early in the morning. The record is significant as potential evidence of communication patterns and contacts. This document is a detailed itemized phone bill for an account, covering calls from August 5-9, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from a location identified as 'White Pis, NY' (likely White Plains, NY), with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile. The document is part of financial records likely subpoenaed for the Epstein investigation. This document is a series of itemized cellular phone billing statements from T-Mobile, covering August and September 2006. It details extensive call activity, primarily to and from locations in New York, including White Plains, the Bronx, Queens, Brooklyn, and Manhattan, with a high volume of mobile-to-mobile calls. The document appears to be part of financial records collected in the investigation, showing communication patterns. This document is a T-Mobile phone bill itemizing local, long distance, and international call charges for an account from August 26, 2006, to September 4, 2006. It shows a high volume of calls, primarily to and from locations in New York City, including White Plains, the Bronx, Queens, and Brooklyn, with many calls marked as mobile-to-mobile.

events.title: High-frequency calling activity begins
events.description: A pattern of numerous calls, primarily to/from White Plains, NY and New York, NY, is recorded on the telephone bill.

events.title: Sustained telecommunication activity period
events.description: The itemized bill records a continuous, high-volume pattern of calls over a one-week period, showing frequent communication, including late-night and early-morning calls.

locations: White Pis, NY (likely White Plains, NY)
keyFacts: The document is a detailed telephone billing statement dated August 21, 2006, covering call activity from July 23-30, 2006.
Call activity shows a high volume of calls, particularly to and from White Plains, NY, and New York, NY, with many calls occurring late at night and early in the morning.
The call log includes mobile-to-mobile calls, incoming calls, and calls to toll-free numbers (1-800).
No specific named individuals are identified in this call log excerpt; it only lists call destinations, times, and types.
The document is likely a financial record subpoenaed or obtained as part of an investigation into communications patterns.
The document is a phone bill showing extensive calling activity between July 30 and August 5, 2006.
The primary call destinations are New York, NY, and a location repeatedly listed as 'White Pls, NY' (White Plains, NY).
There are numerous mobile-to-mobile calls (Call Type F) and several calls to directory assistance ('Dir Asst').
A few calls were made to or from Beverly Hills, CA, during this period.
The bill was generated on August 21, 2006, for an account with customer service number 1-800-937-8997.
The document is a detailed T-Mobile phone bill covering July 21 to August 8, 2006.
It shows an extremely high volume of calls, with numerous calls placed to and from White Plains, NY, often late at night and early in the morning.
Many calls are designated as mobile-to-mobile (Call Type F), suggesting frequent communication between mobile devices on the same network.
The bill includes standard service charges, taxes, and an 'Equipment Protect by Asurion' fee.
No specific individuals are named in this call log excerpt; it only lists call destinations and types.
